bullets.text: Fed minutes: officials split on future cuts; inflation progress uncertain; some favor holding restrictive rates longer, others see room to ease as growth cools.
January G.17 industrial production data frame early-2026 factory momentum; investors watch for recession risk versus soft-landing confirmation.
U.S. mortgage rates fall to a month low, boosting refinance demand—supporting household cashflow while potentially slowing disinflation in shelter-sensitive categories.
Iran strike preparations lift geopolitical risk; oil jumps about 4%, reviving energy-inflation tail risks and adding uncertainty to global growth outlooks.
Etsy sells Depop to eBay for $1.2B at a markdown, signaling refocus on core operations as eBay expands into resale.
Figma shares surge on accelerating AI monetization, reinforcing that investors are rewarding software with measurable revenue lift from generative-AI features.
Microsoft board member’s ~$2M stock buy signals insider confidence amid AI competition, subsidy concerns about China, and prior stock underperformance.
Palo Alto Networks slides post-earnings; AI-driven software repricing pressures cybersecurity multiples even as enterprise security demand remains structurally strong.
Anthropic–Pentagon clash spotlights tension between rapid defense AI deployment and safety/usage constraints, likely influencing procurement rules and model access.
FDA reverses to review Moderna’s mRNA flu shot; FDA chief pushes faster trial approvals, citing competitive pressure from China in early drug development.
Figure fintech data breach affecting ~1M customers underscores rising regulatory and reputational costs of weak cybersecurity in financial platforms.
Breakthrough CRISPR system could reverse antibiotic resistance by precisely removing resistance genes, potentially reshaping infectious-disease treatment and healthcare costs.
Moon is still shrinking, increasing moonquake risk—an engineering and insurance-relevant constraint for long-duration lunar infrastructure and logistics planning.
Satellite-illusion finding suggests Arctic snow loss was underestimated, strengthening evidence of faster climate impacts on water resources and downstream economic risk.
